status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

worklogs.comment:
github-actions[bot] commented on PR #13869:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13869#issuecomment-1214071087

   :warning: Ticket **has no components in JIRA**, make sure you assign one.

github-actions[bot] commented on PR #13869:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13869#issuecomment-1214071091

   :warning: Ticket **has not been started in JIRA**, please click 'Start Progress'.

kou commented on PR #13869:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13869#issuecomment-1214137324

   We can use C++14 by specifying `-DCMAKE_CXX_STANDARD=14`.

kshitij12345 commented on PR #13869:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13869#issuecomment-1214140301

   @kou Do other parts of the library support c++14?  
   (Also are you suggesting to add this flag to the build snippet on the webpage that walks through the build process?)

kou commented on PR #13869:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13869#issuecomment-1214151763

   Yes. We have CI jobs for C++14 and C++ 17.
   
   If our documents miss it, could you update our documents?

kshitij12345 commented on PR #13869:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13869#issuecomment-1214306847

   Sure. Will look into that. Thanks @kou !

kou commented on PR #13869:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13869#issuecomment-1216325009

   Which CI failures are you thinking? There are many CI failures for now (oh...) but it seems that there are no CI failures related to this.

pitrou commented on PR #13869:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13869#issuecomment-1216334171

   Sorry, I mean that merging this PR allows to fix AppVeyor, so we should do it quickly.

kou commented on PR #13869:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13869#issuecomment-1216394823

   Ah, I see. But this is not a real fix. This is just a workaround.
   
   I'll take a look at the CI failure tomorrow. Please wait for a while. If you can't wait, you can merge this.

pitrou commented on PR #13869:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13869#issuecomment-1216411254

   Unblocking AppVeyor would be nice. As for the real fix, there is now some hope that we move to C++17 soon.

kshitij12345 commented on PR #13869:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13869#issuecomment-1216420472

   Besides updating the doc, nothing actionable on for me right? Thanks :)
   
   cc: @pitrou @kou

kou commented on PR #13869:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13869#issuecomment-1217535382

   Continuous discussion about AppVeyor failure: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13903
   
   (I think that we can fix the AppVeyor failure by removing CI jobs on AppVeyor instead of merging this change.)

kshitij12345 closed pull request #13869: ARROW-17406: [C++] Failing to build the C++ Lib with tests
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13869

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: [C++] Failing to build the C++ Lib with tests

comments.body: I think this can be closed now?
